text: Ferenc Krausz (born 17 May 1962) is a Hungarianâ€“Austrian physicist. He worked in attosecond science. He is a director at the Max Planck Institute of Quantum Optics and a professor of experimental physics at the Ludwig Maximilian University of Munich in Germany. In 2023, he won the Nobel Prize in Physics. Krausz was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 2012. ==References== Category:1962 births Category:Living people Category:Hungarian physicists Category:Austrian physicists Category:Members of Academia Europaea
title: Ferenc Krausz
